Hi Greg,


I tried to generate a hemisphere with a completely uniform luminance 
distribution and wanted to use gensky for this, since it offers the 
option -u (uniform sky). But it turns out that the distribution is not 
uniform.
Am I doing something wrong?


gensky 6 12 21  -b 55.86592178771 -u


Gives a zenith-luminance of 10000 cd/m2 (was the goal) and close to the 
horizon around 6500 cd/m2.
Also without the -b option the distribution is not uniform.
Any idea?


Thx!
Jan
